title: How to Contact George W. Bush in Person, Online, or by Mail

steps.title: Send a letter or email to the Office of George W. Bush.
steps.content: Send a letter or email to the Office of George W. Bush. For all general inquiries, you can write a letter or send an email to the President’s official office. If you’re requesting an autograph or photograph, be sure to put your letter in a properly stamped and self-addressed envelope. Send mail or an email to: [1] X Research source Address: Office of George W. Bush P.O. Box 259000 Dallas, TX 75225-9000 USA General Inquiries Email: information@ogwb.org Media Inquiries Email: media@ogwb.org

steps.title: For military retirement congratulatory letters, submit a request online.
steps.content: For military retirement congratulatory letters, submit a request online. Since George W. Bush is no longer Commander in Chief, he isn’t able to sign retirement certificates. However, he does send letters of appreciation to retirees with at least 20 years of service. Wait to submit your request until your retirement ceremony is within 6 months away, then fill out the letter request form online. It can take up to 8 weeks for the office to process your request. [2] X Research source If you haven’t received your Letter of Appreciation after 8 weeks from the date of your submission or you want to submit a request for a civilian retiree, email information@ogwb.org for further information.

steps.title: Visit, email, or call the George W. Bush Presidential Center.
steps.content: Visit, email, or call the George W. Bush Presidential Center. The George W. Bush Presidential Center is a museum located in Dallas, TX, which houses the archives of the George W. Bush presidency. It is open 7 days a week, from 9 AM to 5 PM on Monday through Saturday and 12 PM to 5 PM on Sundays. You can make a call, send an email, or visit the center at: [3] X Research source Phone: 1 (214) 200-4300 Email: info@bushcenter.org Address: George W. Bush Presidential Center 2943 SMU Blvd. Dallas, TX 75205 USA

steps.title: Visit, email, fax, or call the George W. Bush Presidential Library.
steps.content: Visit, email, fax, or call the George W. Bush Presidential Library. The George W. Bush Presidential Library is the 13th presidential library, providing access to official records and artifacts from the former president’s administration. It is located on the grounds of the George W. Bush Presidential Center and follows the same operating hours. You can call, fax, email, or visit the library at: [4] X Research source Phone: 1 (214) 346-1650 Fax: 214-346-1699 Email for Reference & Research Room Inquiries: reference.gwbush@nara.gov Email for FOIA & MDR Inquiries: gwbush.library@mara.gov Email for Audiovisual Inquiries: photos.gwbush@nara.gov Email for Artifact Inquiries: museum.gwbush@nara.gov Email for Education Program: bush43education@nara.gov Address: George W. Bush Presidential Library 2943 SMU Blvd. Dallas, TX 75205 USA

steps.title: X (Formerly Known as Twitter)
steps.content: X (Formerly Known as Twitter) Although Bush doesn't have his own personal X account, the George W. Bush Presidential Center has a verified account you can send a message to. Send a post or direct message here . If you are unsure about an account's authenticity, look for a blue checkmark near the name.

steps.title: Facebook
steps.content: Facebook If you want to get noticed by the former President, replying to his recent Facebook posts is a great strategy. He may not respond personally, but he might see it and it’s worth a shot! Just be respectful and avoid spamming his page with comments. The only official pages run by Bush and his staff include: George W. Bush’s Facebook George W. Bush Presidential Center’s Facebook George W. Bush Presidential Library’s Facebook

steps.title: Instagram
steps.content: Instagram Commenting on photos posted to one of Bush’s official Instagram accounts is another way to contact the former president. Be persistent to increase your chances of getting noticed, and feel free to send a direct message to get in touch with his staff. The only official pages run by the Bush team include: George W. Bush’s Instagram George W. Bush Library’s Instagram The George W. Bush Presidential Center’s Instagram

steps.title: Fill out an online form or send an email to the Bush Center.
steps.content: Fill out an online form or send an email to the Bush Center. To invite George W. Bush to speak at your event, submit this scheduling request form , or shoot an email to scheduling@ogwb.org . Make sure your event is at least 6 months from the date of request for consideration. The Bush Center will contact you once they make their final decision, which may take up to 6 weeks. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Where can I find Executive Orders issued by George W. Bush?
steps.content: Where can I find Executive Orders issued by George W. Bush? You can access the Executive Orders by visiting the archived White House website , the National Archives and Records Administration , and the American Presidency Project . [6] X Research source

steps.title: Where can I find speeches given by George W. Bush?
steps.content: Where can I find speeches given by George W. Bush? To access public speeches, visit the archived White House website . You may be able to access the Public Papers of the Presidents of the United States, which include public messages, speeches, and oral and written statements, at the Office of the Federal Register and the American Presidency Project . [7] X Research source

steps.title: Where can I find press briefings from the Bush Administration?
steps.content: Where can I find press briefings from the Bush Administration? You can access press briefings by visiting the archived White House website . [8] X Research source

steps.title: Do George W. Bush and George H.W. Bush share the same Library?
steps.content: Do George W. Bush and George H.W. Bush share the same Library? No, the George W. Bush Presidential Library is located in Dallas, while the George H.W. Bush Library is located in College Station, TX. For more information about the George H.W. Bush Presidential Library, you can visit his official website , or contact the museum at: [9] X Research source Phone: 1 (979) 691-4010 Address: George H.W. Bush Presidential Library and Museum 1000 George Bush Drive West College Station, TX 77845 USA

steps.title: Has George W. Bush published any books?
steps.content: Has George W. Bush published any books? Yes, he has written and published 5 books. His first book was released in 1999 while he was the Governor of Texas, and the rest of his books were published during his post-presidency: [10] X Research source A Charge to Keep (1999) Decision Points (2010) 41: A Portrait of My Father (2014) Portraits of Courage: A Commander in Chief’s Tribute to America’s Warriors (2017) Out of Many, One: Portraits of America’s Immigrants (2021)

steps.title: Where is George W. Bush living right now?
steps.content: Where is George W. Bush living right now? Currently, George W. Bush and his wife Laura Bush reside at Prairie Chapel Ranch in Midland, Texas. They also bought a home in an exclusive neighborhood near Southern Methodist University in Dallas, Texas. [11] X Research source
